channel.title: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder
channel.description:
Two birds with one stone! I'll remove the laser diode from an old DVD burner and use the remains as a on-demand cupholder!
Pictures, etc as soon as I embark on this endeavor. Post comments and suggestions!
EDIT: Circuit diagram attached (lasr v1.png). I'm thinking of revising it with a fourth mode for blinking using a 555 IC. EDIT2: Just realized that image is 400x300 = 4:3. Feel free to upscale and use as wallpaper xD

item.title: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Man UTD Freak:

I was unsure of what you meant by Position 2 = ‘Momentary.’

Theres a push-to-make switch just after that >.>

[quote=“io9, post:14, topic:282579”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=373406.msg2817727#msg2817727 date=1244391218]
io9 laser graffiti
[/quote]
Explain yourself…[/quote]

http://blog.makezine.com/archive/2008/01/learn_how_to_do_laser_gra.html

Read full topic

item.title: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

T4_:

This reminds me of a jeopardy game I made with my friend. It will be interesting to see how bright and how far the projection from laser will be.

They’re amazing if you get it right :D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 07, 2009, 04:14:08 pm[/size][hr]io9 laser graffiti

item.title: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Fat Cookies:

On the subject of your “on-demand” cup holder are you going to hook up the motor onto a conveyor?

No, just gonna use the remnants of the case with a DPST flip switch to open/close.

Read full topic

item.source: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder

item.title: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:9, topic:282579”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=373406.msg2817429#msg2817429 date=1244377511]
I might do it with a standard computer fan, but I’m not sure what to do with 2 of the pins that manage the speed on the Molex connector.
[/quote]
You would use at least a 9V, but I recommend at least 4 9V (36V) to get good results. There aren’t any pins that manage the speed, its the voltage that determines the speed.[/quote]
Silly me, the other 2 pins are for grounding. (http://www.hardwarezone.com/img/data/articles/2004/1215/tutorial-4pin_molex_power_conn.jpg)

On the subject of your “on-demand” cup holder are you going to hook up the motor onto a conveyor?

Read full topic
item.source: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder

item.title: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Fat Cookies:

I might do it with a standard computer fan, but I’m not sure what to do with 2 of the pins that manage the speed on the Molex connector.

You would use at least a 9V, but I recommend at least 4 9V (36V) to get good results. There aren’t any pins that manage the speed, its the voltage that determines the speed.

bootnecklad:

But why would you want a blinking laser?

For lulz.

Read full topic
item.source: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder

item.title: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder

I need a dvd burner first But why would you want a blinking laser?

item.source: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder

item.title: Project Idea: DVD Burner -> Laser Pointer + Cup Holder
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:2, topic:282579”][quote author=io9 link=topic=373406.msg2817037#msg2817037 date=1244344902]
Two birds with one stone! I’ll remove the laser diode from an old DVD burner and use the remains as a on-demand cupholder!

Pictures, etc as soon as I embark on this endeavor. Post comments and suggestions!
[/quote]

Sort of what I did with my old xbox.

Used the fan as a coaster (it’s on my desk right now).[/quote]

What are you using to power it? How many volts?

I might do it with a standard computer fan, but I’m not sure what to do with 2 of the pins that manage the speed on the Molex connector.

Read full topic
